body_html:
I'll follow up on this one.

We need to remove pkg_tar from bazel repository (much like other rules) so
I'll take the action there.

On Mon, Nov 14, 2016 at 8:26 PM gunan notifications@github.com wrote:

Found the culprit, it is a new pkg_tar rule.
Are there corresponding issues for the py3 compatilibility of build_tar on
bazel side?
Or would you like to keep this open to track that?

—
You are receiving this because you were assigned.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
#5569 (comment),
or mute the thread
https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ADjHf7iAm823H_cQdG2DMQMoiOpK0Rfsks5q-LX2gaJpZM4KwkrW

body:
I'll follow up on this one.

We need to remove pkg_tar from bazel repository (much like other rules) so
I'll take the action there.

On Mon, Nov 14, 2016 at 8:26 PM gunan notifications@github.com wrote:

> Found the culprit, it is a new pkg_tar rule.
> Are there corresponding issues for the py3 compatilibility of build_tar on
> bazel side?
> Or would you like to keep this open to track that?
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you were assigned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
